sources.title: "Just Suppose" (1926) starring Richard Barthelmess, Lois Moran
sources.description: This gem is presented by Silent Hall of Fame.   Please visit https://silent-hall-of-fame.org/   to support our non-profit mission and the legacy of silent movie stars by making a tax deductible contribution.   FEEL FREE TO FOLLOW US ON TWITTER @SilentFilmGems     This is a short preview. You can watch the whole film here: https://silent-hall-of-fame.org/index.php/gems-for-donation    "Just Suppose" is a drama and romance starring Richard Barthelmess and Lois Moran. A distant heir to a European monarchy, who is free to marry at will, falls in love with an American girl. Then he suddenly becomes first in line for the throne and must marry a woman from royal circles.   Directed by                     Kenneth S. Webb Produced by                   Inspiration Pictures Scenario                         C. Graham Baker Based on                         the play by A.E. Thomas Starring                          Richard Barthelmess, Lois Moran, Geoffrey Kerr, Henry Vibart, George Spelvin Cinematography            Stuart Kelson   Distributed by                First National Pictures Release date                    January 10, 1926 Running time                  77 minutes Country                           United States Language                         Silent film, English intertitles   Copyright Disclaimer Under Section 107 of the Copyright Act 1976: "Allowance is made for "fair use" for purposes such as criticism, comment, news reporting, teaching, scholarship, and research. Fair use is a use permitted by copyright statute that might otherwise be infringing. Non-profit, educational or personal use tips the balance in favor of fair use."

metadata.Writer: A.E. Thomas, Violet E. Powell, C. Graham Baker
metadata.Actors: Richard Barthelmess, Lois Moran, Geoffrey Kerr
